name: C.R. Grimmer
bio:
C.R. Grimmer/Chelsea Grimmer is a poet, scholar, and lecturer originally from the Detroit area. Grimmer, who uses she/her and they/them pronouns interchangeably, earned their MA and MFA at Portland State University and PhD in Literature and Cultural Studies from the University of Washington, Seattle. They are the author of the chapbook O (ezekiel’s wife) (GASHER Press, 2019), which features visual work and collaborations with the artist, poet, and novelist Colleen Burner. Grimmer is also at work on a prequel manuscript, The Lyme Letters, which has been supported by the Harlan Hahn Disability Studies Endowment. Their poems and essays have appeared in journals including the Comparatist, Drunken Boat, FENCE, and Poetry magazine, among others.
Grimmer is the creator, host, and producer of The Poetry Vlog (TPV), a YouTube channel and podcast dedicated to building social justice coalitions through higher education, poetry, pop culture, and related arts dialogues. TPV is supported by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation and the Jack Straw Cultural Center; its third season will air October 2019 through June 2020.
Grimmer teaches multimodal composition, creative writing, and cultural studies at the University of Washington’s Seattle and Bothell campuses and at South Seattle Community College. They currently live in Seattle.
